meanings.definition: A person who is willing to harm others in order to achieve their goals.
meanings.sent1: The cutthroat always put his own success above the well-being of others.
meanings.sent2: The business world can be full of cutthroats who will do anything to get ahead.
meanings.sent3: The cutthroat in the movie was so focused on winning that he forgot about being kind.
meanings.sent4: The political arena is often described as a cutthroat environment where only the strongest survive.
meanings.sent5: The image of a cutthroat is someone who stops at nothing to reach their desired outcome.

meanings.sent1: She was known as a cutthroat in the sports world for her fierce determination to win.
meanings.sent2: The cutthroat nature of the industry meant that only the most competitive would succeed.
meanings.sent3: The cutthroat player on the team always pushed others to do their best.
meanings.sent4: In the world of sales, you have to be a cutthroat to stay ahead of the game.
meanings.sent5: The cutthroat attitude of the boxer made him a formidable opponent in the ring.

meanings.sent1: The cutthroat race to the finish line had everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent2: The cutthroat nature of the tournament brought out the best in all the participants.
meanings.sent3: The cutthroat battle for the top spot was both thrilling and exhausting.
meanings.sent4: The cutthroat world of fashion design demanded constant innovation and creativity.
meanings.sent5: The cutthroat atmosphere in the courtroom made every case feel like a high-stakes drama.
